alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Western Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Louisa, Goochland and west central Hanover Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hadensville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goochland, Hadensville, Gum Spring, Fife, Oilville, Montpelier, Wyndham, Orchid, Vontay, Maidens, Irwin, Johnsons Springs, Tabscott, Othma, Sandy Hook, Coatesville, Goodall, Mabelton, Caledonia and Elk Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
